# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year • Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

## 1) Themes to Watch
- Rising deployment and cost pressures in solar PV manufacturing, especially in China and India.
- Offshore wind capacity expansion and investment shifts, including major asset co-ownership changes.
- Increasing regulatory moves to enable flexible grid connections for distributed solar and community projects.
- Strategic moves and technological focus in AI inference economics and digital twin applications for renewables.
- Geopolitical and security events impacting subsea cable infrastructure.
- Domestic content requirements impacting battery storage and renewable project supply chains.

## 2) What to Monitor Next

### Grid / Transmission
- Impact of regulatory orders for utilities to accommodate flexible grid connections for community solar (U.S. state level).
- Risks and consequences from subsea cable damage and geopolitical tensions affecting grid resilience.

### Renewables
- Offshore wind developments with focus on China’s leadership in turbine capacity and new ownership in Hornsea 3.
- Solar PV sector dynamics: UK record CfD volumes, India’s >20 GW domestic PV manufacturing, and potential project exits by Chinese manufacturers.
- Emerging use of AI-powered digital twins for floating PV system optimization.
- Battery storage policy shifts in India mandating minimum domestic content.

### Oil & Gas
- Not enough information in headlines.

### Data Centers & AI
- Growing importance of AI "inference economics" in 2026 as highlighted by investment figures.
- Application of AI in renewable energy digital twin technology and facility monitoring.

### Semiconductors
- Semiconductor manufacturing outlook tied to Intel’s Arizona fab performance and wafer pricing trends in China.

### Rare Earth / Critical Minerals
- Not enough information in headlines.

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly
- China: Leading offshore wind turbine capacity, solar manufacturing pricing and project developments.
- India: Significant solar manufacturing growth and battery storage domestic content mandates.
- UK: Solar CfD deployment and offshore wind investment.
- Apollo (financial investor): Co-ownership of Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm.
- Intel (semiconductors): New fab and industry outlook.

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines
- Supply chain and project stability concerns from China solar manufacturer potential project exit.
- Grid integration challenges from increased community solar requiring flexible utility approaches.
- Security and geopolitical risk from subsea cable disruptions linked to conflict or sabotage.
- Pricing pressure and cost floor uncertainties in Chinese solar wafer/module market.
- Impact of domestic content requirements on battery storage project timelines and costs in India.
